metadata.title: CVE-2022-4144 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the QXL display device emulation inQEMU. The qxl_phys2virt() function does not check the size of the structurepointed to by the guest physical address, potentially reading past the endof the bar space into adjacent pages. A malicious guest user could use thisflaw to crash the QEMU process on the host causing a denial of servicecondition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3

qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
